metadata.Title: CVE-2014-7947 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
OpenJPEG before r2944, as used in PDFium in Google Chrome before40.0.2214.91, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service(out-of-bounds read) via a crafted PDF document, related to j2k.c, jp2.c,pi.c, t1.c, t2.c, and tcd.c.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-7947` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 40.0.2214.94-0ubuntu1.1120
chromium-browser-l10n - 40.0.2214.94-0ubuntu1.1120
chromium-chromedriver - 40.0.2214.94-0ubuntu1.1120
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 40.0.2214.94-0ubuntu1.1120
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 40.0.2214.94-0ubuntu1.1120
No subscription required

libopenjp2-7 - 2.1.1-1
libopenjp2-tools - 2.1.1-1
libopenjp3d-tools - 2.1.1-1
libopenjp3d7 - 2.1.1-1
libopenjpip-dec-server - 2.1.1-1
libopenjpip-server - 2.1.1-1
libopenjpip-viewer - 2.1.1-1
libopenjpip7 - 2.1.1-1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '40.0.2214.94-0ubuntu1.1120').
openjpeg2 package in esm-apps/bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.1.1-1').
